Class TextProcessor

java.lang.Object
ie.atu.sw.TextProcessor
public class TextProcessor extends Object
TextProcessor Class - Processes input text files by simplifying words based on embeddings and a predefined Google word list. This class handles: - Simplifying text files by replacing words not in the Google Map with their closest match. - Calculating cosine similarity for word vector comparison. - Finding the closest matching word in the Google Map.
Author:
Eric Murray - G00423903

  • Constructor Details

    • TextProcessor

      public TextProcessor(Map<String,double[]> googleWordsMap, Map<String,double[]> embeddingsMap)
      Constructs a TextProcessor with the specified Google Map and embeddings Map.
      Parameters:
      googleWordsMap - a Map of Google words with their corresponding embeddings.
      embeddingsMap - a Map of embeddings for all words.

  • Method Details

    • simplifyText

      public void simplifyText(String inputPath, String outputPath) throws IOException
      Simplifies the input text file by replacing words not in the Google Map with their closest match, and writes the result to the output file.
      Parameters:
      inputPath - the path to the input text file.
      outputPath - the path to the output text file.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during file reading or writing. Big-O Notation O(m * n) n: Number of lines in the input file m: average number of words per line

    • findClosestWord

      public String findClosestWord(String wordToChange)
      Finds the closest word in the Google Map to the specified word based on cosine similarity of their vector representations.
      Parameters:
      wordToChange - the word to find a replacement for.
      Returns:
      the closest matching word from the Google Map. Big-O Notation O(k) k: number of entries in the googleMap

    • calcCosineSim

      public static double calcCosineSim(double[] vectorA, double[] vectorB)
      Calculates the cosine similarity between two vectors.
      Parameters:
      vectorA - the first vector to compare.
      vectorB - the second vector to compare.
      Returns:
      the cosine similarity between the two vectors.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the vectors have different lengths. Big-O Notation O(n) n: the number of vectors in each array
